turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hi, I need to check my checking account balance and see if a specific check cleared. It was check number 1234, and I wrote it to 'Acme Corp' about a week ago.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Okay, I can help with that. To access your account, can you please verify the last four digits of your social security number and your date of birth?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Sure, it's xxxx and mm/dd/yyyy. Ugh, I hate having to give this information every time!

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Thank you. Please hold while I access your account... Okay, your current checking account balance is $1,257.32. I'm checking for check number 1234 to Acme Corp. ... Yes, that check cleared on 2024-02-29 for $75.00.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Great, thanks! Now, I'm a little confused about these new 'service fees' I'm seeing on my statement. What are they, and how can I avoid them?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Regarding the service fees, these are now charged monthly if your average daily balance falls below $500. To avoid them, you need to maintain that minimum balance, switch to a different checking account type, or set up a recurring direct deposit of at least $250 per month.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, thanks. But why wasn't I notified about this change? It seems unfair to suddenly start charging fees without telling people. Is there any way to get that fee waived this month as a one-time courtesy?
